official-title.#text:
To amend the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of
		  1974 to ensure health care coverage value and transparency for dental benefits
		  under group health plans.

committee-name.#text:
Committee
			 on Education and the Workforce

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

Dental coverage helps approximately 173
			 million Americans get the dental care that is vital to ensuring good oral and
			 overall health.

Unfair practices
			 of dental benefit plans hinder patients’ ability to receive the full benefits
			 for which they pay and, in some cases, provide the dental insurance industry
			 with windfall profits.

short-title.#tail:
will help consumers receive the full value of their dental
			 coverage.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Subpart B of part 7 of subtitle B of title I
			 of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974/t:I/st:B/pt:7/spt:B

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,
				self-insured limited scope dental benefits (described in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974/s:732/ss:c/p:1
Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974/s:733/ss:c/p:2

text.#text:
The requirements of
				this section shall apply to self-insured group health plans insofar as they
				provide dental benefits (including, notwithstanding

In order to ensure that participants and
				beneficiaries in a group health plan receive full value from dental benefits,
				the plan shall meet the following requirements:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
establishes, based upon similar model regulations
				developed by the National Association of Insurance commissioners.

text.#text:
The
				plan shall provide for coordination of benefits in a manner so that the plan
				pays the same amount regardless of other coverage for such benefits so long as
				the total amount paid does not exceed 100 percent of the amount of the
				applicable claim. Such coordination shall be effected consistent with such
				rules as the

In the case of a plan that provides dental
				benefits through a network of providers, the plan shall permit a participant or
				beneficiary to designate payment of dental benefits to a provider who is not
				participating in the
				network.

header.#text:
Equity for
				dental patients through assignment of benefits
